Let me start off by saying if you like Star Wars then you will definitely enjoy this "game." The visuals are good and I'm sure they are even better on the Rift S. Also, the sounds are spot on which is essential for anything Star Wars. However, this game was mostly a let down for me. I can look past the short length since it is only ten dollars but I expected more interaction with the environment and I was certainly not expecting to be restricted as much as I was. You can't really get lost in the experience because it is constantly forcing you to stay in one place which was really frustrating. Moreover, it's a bummer that your hands go through the walls and every object. Even worse is that if you put your head through anything you are shown a screen that tells you to move back. Unfortunately, all of this really detracts from the overall experience. I also found the combat to be extremely boring. I'm sure it will get better with the next episodes but being locked in one place while enemies repeat the exact same moves from the same sides over and over is a shame. I'm a Star Wars fan so I wasn't completely disappointed but I likely won't be playing again except maybe to show it to a friend.

review_title: Best Star Wars Game for VR
one_reviews_text:
To start, I played on my original Rift. 

This game is definetely the best Star Wars game there is for VR. I felt that it was well written and the gameplay mechanics were stellar. One big thing is that the game only lasts about 30-40 minutes, however I would rather play a short, well thought out game then a long, boring one. 

In my opinon, this is well worth the 10 dollars and I can't wait for episode 2 to release!

The game is mostly lightsaber training. The story is a little something extra.  Making it through the story  when I first started I almost sent the game back.  The story was good but very short 30-40 min. However after giving the dojo a fair chance I realized what this game mainly is, lightsaber training.  In 10 or so rounds  you will improve , provided you're paying attention to the tips, and the game will become even more enjoyable. Definetly a fun lightsaber training game.

It's short and the replay value is very low. But for the short amount of time you play it, it's amazing!
Like watching a good movie, but you're in it. I want more! :)
One thing that the game shows again, what Lone Echo did before to surprise me, is something that only really works in VR to me. The size of things.
You really feel the size of the world around you while you move through it, especially in big places.
I really hope the next episodes come soon. But I also really hope that they will be longer!

Fantastic STAR WARS experience. I need more. Voice acting and everything was very well done- I loved how they pulled in Episode 3 material. The only thing I'd change is the snap-movement. I loved being throw into the action and the witty driod commentary. It was TOO SHORT. I need more of this real bad. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because it was $10 for about a 25 minute play through.

My exception to everyone's comments is that I find the allowed play-space to be super small and jarring when it comes to combat.  The display goes black and tells me to step back constantly.  Between that and my guardian boundary warnings, it was very jarring and confusing to know where I am in space.  This caused me to hit my hand pretty hard on one of my floor speakers.  I've been playing in this VR space for almost a year now so it's nothing new.  Here's the thing: the play space this title allows is much smaller than my guardian boundaries.  It not a big deal until saber combat.  The moment you duck or dodge out of the the play space the display goes black with a warning to get back in your space.   Meanwhile droids are swinging on you and you're blind.  What you end up doing is trying to manage combat, the play space, and your guardian space so you don't go blind.  It's very immersion breaking.  

I must say that's it's an overall good experience and worth the $10.  There's much more to this title than combat and it is not exactly a game.  But immersion should still be a priority.  I hope any immersion breaking elements can be updated.  

This was a first run and I ran everything on default.  Will try the 360 mode and report back.

Update:  I played it again seated and it seems to make much more sense as I didn't have to worry about stepping out of bounds and could just enjoy the storytelling.  However, during saber combat I did break boundaries twice just by leaning.  I'm referring to the last chapter.

I've done The Void twice and this experience is more akin to that than say Battlefront 2.  It's by all means a guided experience rather than an RPG or first person combat experience.  If you're looking for great Saber combat this is NOT it.  But if you're looking to be immersed in the Star Wars universe where you're the center of the story, then it does a good job of that.

review_title: Great, but I expected a little more.
one_reviews_text:
Honestly, this (and hopefully another episode) is probably the best Star Wars VR of all time. It isn't as quite as immersive in the beggining, but you do a lot of stuff that is pretty cool. My only (non-spoiler) complaint would be that this was $10, but the main story was only approximately 40-50 minutes. However, (if I remember correctly), Oculus' Refund Policy allows you to return a game under 2 hours of playing it. So you can do the story and then return it if you want.

You get to use a lightsaber, as well as this tool to hotwire doors and stuff. You also end up climbing a good amount of ladders, as well as walking around edges (hella realistic). The lightsaber combat is pretty cool, but you don't get to do a lot of it, and in the duels that you do, you can't really move around too much. Once again, I really dislike how the main story was only about 40-50 minutes long. There is a sort of challenge mode that you can do besides the campaign, but that kinda bored me after 15 minutes. But this game is pretty nice overall.

Very nicely produced game, though quite short as per the VR games go it seem... Hopefullt there will be more content coming, considering the "Episode" wording in the title. 
 Would be nice if there was information about how long an experience like this is, mentioned somewhere in the game specs.  Something like "Interactive experience, about x minutes of story." and if there's side missions/tasks to do then mention that too - like the Lightsaber dojo. 

 Otherwise great work and hope for more.

review_title: Rift S Dies EVERY TIME I play
one_reviews_text: Title says it all really, if I'm lucky I get a couple of minutes and then it freezes the view or blacks out my monitors and my Rift S. Restarted, reinstalled, verified drivers. This is the ONLY game that gives me this trouble to out of both Oculus and Steam libraries. It's insane and incredibly disappointing - we're talking about VR Star Wars this should be making me giggle, not sigh. I'm currently looking for the how to refund option.

Okay yea its not as long as we all would like but this is the level of immersion we all want. After one playthrough I found myself thinking about the story what the heck just happened. Most VR "experiences" end with, "oh that was cool", and thats that.  High quality stuff here.
this game is extremely fum amd imersive worth the 11$
Great game that shows the power of virtual reality in the Star Wars universe

review_title: Cool concept but way too short!
one_reviews_text: Its a cool concept, but the story mode was way too short. Overall disappointing. I reached the end and thought "thats it?". Theres also not much in the way of content. Felt like 5 minutes of fumbling in the dark, followed by a whole lot of climbing ladders, witnessing a couple of video scenes and the final fight scene there never seemed to be much threat. My light sabre skills were pretty naff, but it didnt seem like i'd die from the attack.

I'm a picky gamer. Not a lot of game can make me come out and play. I usually test a game for a few minutes and immediately I can decide whether I'd like it or not. THIS GAME HOWEVER, IT REALLY IS AMAZING! Great story, Great environment and awesome CGI. 

Man, having Darth Vader in your face is really something else. Looking forward for the second episode and more episodes to come. My bruised hands can take on more. 

COME AND TAKE ALL MY MONEY!

This is a passable adventure with limited gameplay and interactivity. You would expect to see it in some location VR experience so that everybody who paid for the hour can go through the whole thing.

It's a lot like a Lone Echo knock off by a less talented developer with some combat sequences. The production values are good in some ways but in others it lacks polish.

Progress only triggers if you stand on very specific points indicated by a marker, which harms immersion.

There's no smooth turning (an option like that in the settings just makes it so the snap-turn has a smooth rotation animation, it's still a preset angle turn, it's just not an instant step of the camera but an animated gradual one).

The VR hands have slow animations for the different gestures (like pointing or closing to a fist or when they assume a position ready to grab an interactive object you hover over) rather than respond instantly like Oculus Home (or Lone Echo or other game) hands.

There's a tool you can use in the game, basically an electric screwdriver, where when you hold it in your hand you can press the trigger and see it spin up yet when you use it on applicable objects it automatically spins up and unscrews the thing without a press.

Stormtrooper laser blasts you can deflect travel way too slow, slower than the drone blasts in the dojo, it looks off.

There are gameplay flaws and such inconsistencies all over, even in the okay lightsaber combat.

The story has inconsistencies too. Vader says at one point that he senses the force within you. Which is cool, but you've been using a lightsaber for a while which you'd think would have made it obvious.

The game also stutters here and there regardless of being in low or high settings (there's nothing else) on an i7 3770K and GTX1080.

If you want to get a Quest game for PC, I suggest Journey of the Gods instead. It's not without issues but it's a complete polished experience with meaty gameplay, not an unpolished tech demo like this.

VR is about experimentation, this is a long call of duty cutscene. Its pretty cool to be inside the starwars universe with lifesized aliens and lightsabers and such but you are constantly reminded you are an observer with very minor freedoms.

First game that made me notice poor black levels in my Rift S. Other games look fine but this one is super washed out. Even for my friends who are mega starwars fans I dont think I would show them this due to the poor visual quality. Also, whats up with the worst landscape skybox in existence? It looked worse than a revist to half-lifes cliff scene skybox.

Next episode needs more freedom, more content, improved visuals.

No problems at all running on high settings, and although super short like others have said I actually quite enjoyed it, but I actually enjoyed the Dojo more. So its totally worth it just for that once you have completed the 35-40  minute story part.  The Dojo has 120 levels and you can unlock different hilts and saber colours.  For the price I would say this is a pretty good experience and mini game.

review_title: The Potential Is Just Around The Corner.
one_reviews_text: To put it simply, the saber combat is similar to blade and sorcery. this is an incrdeible experience which could be a game. The only thing missing is the other episodes, which is why it only gets 4 stars. the story is on par with alot of other star wars games. One in particular is The Force Unleashed. There are no reasons why we cannot get this level of detail on the scale of Skyrim VR. Something like that would sell more headsets in an instant. I would definatley recommend this to any Star Wars fan.

review_title: Pretty good, bugged and too dark
one_reviews_text: It's pretty solid but I got stuck on top of the elevator when heading to the caverns, and every area is so dark you can barely see anything. Make brighter in most places, fix the bug. Light saber training is fun and cool! Climbing mechanic (manual, not automatic) is really cool. Have to go back in and see if I have to re-do everything due to the bug. Worth $10 IMO.

Any Star Wars fan will undoubtedly give this game 5 stars and say it's the best VR game they've ever played. I however, will  be a bit more critical.

Positives:
Not bad graphics
VR interaction (available) was reasonably impressive - i felt some feedback and weight to some of the heavier interactions, like turning a heavy metallic object.
Frickin' light sabres were awesome but you can't really mess that up.
A clear and interesting-ish Storyline. 

Negatives: 
Limited interaction with the environment - a little too structured and you couldn't just walk around and have a good explore.
Would have been fun to fire some laser guns.
Short. REALLY SHORT gameplay.

The game environement is great  and vader is quite impressive to behold. The blaster deflection is fun to use. However, it is MUCH MUCH short and the limitations of the simulation show. For instance, some actions can only be accomplished by the right hand in the puzzle sequences. For 13.19CAD$ in my case, the price is a bit steep. 5 stars at a lower pricepoint like 5 to 7 $.

review_title: Has my hand been cut off?
one_reviews_text:
Nice game, could do with being a little longer though!

The problem is, i am forced to play left handed! 

My right is in the game, moves around and points etc but i cannot get it to pick up a light saber. Fix this bug and it gets an extra star!

My initial thought was "$10? How?!"

But then I completed the story in, maybe, an hour. It's a great, highly-detailed Star Wars VR experience that makes good use of the technology and adds what seems to be leading into a really cool story within the Star War universe. Maya Rudolph is a fun semi-narrator as ZOE3, with some decently funny banter; and Steve Blum as Karius is a really cool-looking (and sounding) new bad guy. Only notches against it would be the short length, even for an episodic game; and the annoying habit for the game to jar you out of the experience with a "Return to Scene" screen if your head bobs even a little out of where it wants you. For example, when climbing certain pipes in a certain scene, the natural movement of the character kept throwing me into the "Return to Scene" screen despite being more or less on-rails.

So...really cool intro experience for $10, tons of detail and atmosphere, but the only downside is really just the extremely short length.

It is an amazing experience but it roughly lasts between 30-40 minutes, most of which is narrative. The actual gameplay is less than half of this time and it contains only two battle scenes, one where you deflect lasers from storm troopers and a lightsaber fight. I would give it 5 stars if only it lasted more than 3 hours, but for this much, 1 star is all it deserves.

review_title: Mediocre game that satisfies a fandom
one_reviews_text:
It is nice to have a proper Star Wars game.  However, being Star Wars and episodic in nature does not justify what is a pretty substandard game.  There is a lack of smooth turning (what is labelled as such in the menu is just a different snap turn).  The game is exceptionally dark which does not lend itself well to the Rift-S.  Also there are many "events" in game where you are locked in spot.  If you move your head where the game does not like it pops up a black screen telling you to return to play area.  This really pulls you out of what immersion there is in a 30-40 minute walking simulator.

Edit - Any attempt to refund the game fails for me.  It looks like under categories Vader Immortal is classified as a movie which would make it ineligable for refunds.

The droid is so annoying I had to quit playing. Whoever hired this actor should be fired. The sound design is also bad. When you turn away from someone speaking it almost completly mutes one ear. Does not sound natural. I dropped a tool in the prison and it would not let me go back to get it. 1/10

The coolness of being in a star wars movie is the only thing that is really good about this game. (And I have to admit that part is pretty awesome.)  It is short.  $9.99 might seem like a good price if you know it is short, but it isn't $9.99 worth of short.  

It plays exactly like most other first person shooter games you have ever played.  Not much about the game play will stand out as new.  Teleport here and there.  Grab handles to climb ladders.  Swing a light saber mindlessly to attack.  Watch your enemy and block when he swings.  All standard (boring) fare for VR.

The only mechanic I though was good and new (to me at least) is being able to deflect blaster fire and bounce it back at the shooter.  That was pretty cool and, other than being in a star wars story, the highlight of the game for me.

Doing tasks and opening doors is mindlessly tedious.  Insert tool.  Turn knob.  Flip lever.  All the boring stuff VR has given over the past few years.   

I was hoping for more.  Maybe more will be delivered in future parts.   I was hoping for a combat system where you use the force to maybe see a little into the future to detect where the next attack is coming or something that can put you into slow motion like Super Hot.  

I would rather simply tag along for the ride and be immersed in a star wars story than have to waste time pushing buttons, flipping levers, and waving my saber around like a crazy person.

review_title: An additional workout game for me!
one_reviews_text:
When you play the training dojo you'll know what I mean when I say getting a workout because man I started sweating when I got to level 4 in the Dojo and failing at least 4 or 5 times, but eventually I beat it and the best score.

The story was cool even though it was short like the devs said it would be, but honestly it didn't really feel that short, might be because I was messing around trying to explore what I could and doing a little roleplay with the characters lol.

This is well worth the price and I can't wait for Episode 2.

Being a Star Wars fan, I have been waiting for this game to be available. I love the special effects, I especially love the dojo where you can practice with your lightsaber but the game itself was too short. I was expecting a couple of hours of playtime and instead got less than 1 hour. I am hoping that episode 2 and 3 will give much more gameplay then episode 1. Otherwise it was an excellent game and I thoroughly enjoyed it and we'll play it again. I especially will play the dojo as I enjoy practicing with my lightsaber.

Overall I really enjoyed my experience with this game. Graphics were great as well as the overall gameplay. The story lasted for about 40 minutes give or take. It also has some great wow moments and some cool easter eggs. I'm rating it a 5 because for the price you get a solid intro story and an awesome mini-game which offers hours of re-play ability.

OMG! This is the best Oculus experience other than Robo Recall and Elite Dangerous@dbHRGdb . Anyways, this game needs punches and powers or something with the second hand. I feel the single controller is good since imbidextrous, but!, my other hand is super bored and swings to punch to avail. Also when i have sword turned down as in a thumbs down motion to block, I always get striked and goes right through the sword. Not to happy about that. I was a black belt in my younger years and feel this game is a great work out. I feel the progression could pick up the pace a bit more after level fifteen. Where's the Darth Maul's bowstaff? I'm not scoring perfect everytime. but still a bit slow at higher levels. Love the game, super awesome, the dojo is way better than the story, graphics could be better too, but when characters stand bigger than me 6'4" @ 215lbs, I feel something new that is rare. Lacks visual content, such as better texturs and eye candy compaired to other Oculus Sponsered titles, same goes with Lucus name on there. Oculus is an eye candy platform, fail in either super fun play or killer experience, risky flop. But the Dojo! - bring play re-play-ability!! For that, I give it 3 thumbs up!! Got on one, but the story with poor experience, thats why its free or $10 buck. StormLand seems to hit both for the first time. Common Lucus Arts!!

PS, The only reason the story seemed to short was because there was nothing to turn your head to look at, other than exploring your ship that got high jacked. Oculus isn't a tunnel vision or linear experience. It's a 360 experience. now that there is Diagonal Setup for Rift and those who have 3x setups, Rift S, as well as Quest. this should better. But, Dojo Rocks!! If you can't do better in the story and textures, focus on that!! Multi Dojo!! More wepons, build my own custom sword!! Those who can will.

It may be a bit short, but I have never played anything so amazing in my life before. The lightsaber combat is amazing and feels so good (though there aint much of it). The environment looks so beautiful and just stunning. But the story, the story is unblieveable! If you even remotly love Star Wars, you will fall head-over-heals in love with a story like this. Wish it was a bit longer, 10/10, best thing on VR.

Quick disclaimer - go in understanding it's short (45 mins - 1 hour at most, 30 mins for those who go through it quickly). Your expectations need to be set right on this so you're not disappointed by the length. They're called "episodes", after all!

Lightsaber combat is AWESOME - everything I dreamed wielding a lightsaber would be since I was a kid! 

Story is very interesting, a central part of the experience. I won't give any details away, but it's clear to see how this canonical story will add to the overall lore of Star Wars. It leaves us with a cliffhanger we'll want to learn more about.

Voice acting ranges from decent to good, and is never disappoints or detracts from the story. Most importantly, Scott Lawrence does a good job with Vader's voice (that's critical for obvious reasons).

Environments are fascinating, and they make you want to look around. This keeps it from feeling like the experiencde is "on rails" too much, but the story still moves quickly / you don't get lost in the environments.

Overall an extremely solid outing, and I look forward to the continuation of the story in the next episode!

If you have ever wanted to be in the star wars universe this game is for you! Though it may only be up to two hours long possibly less it is worth the price it is at. Even after completion you have the jedi dojo which is a wave based light sabre game, where you fight continous waves of light sabre battles and reflecting blasters to unlock new crystal colours etc. 

The Main Game was breath taking. Everything looked and felt amazing, the visuals of the star destroyer was breath taking. Meeting Lord Vader was as a long time star wars fan an indescribable feeling, he was tall dark and imposing. Everything just felt right!

The story itself is quite interesting and promises to get even better as the episodes go on, do yourself a favour and don't miss out on this experience, the light sabre battles felt so genuine. It may have been short but i've not enjoyed a game this much in over a year!

Well done oculus yet another amazing quality game from you. You are the true pioneers fo VR

Pros
It is Star Wars! 
It is VR! 
It has light sabers!
it has two or three really cool moments 

Cons
It is under an hour
It has little to no replay value
It does not have a lot of gameplay to it 
It is $10

I thought it was worth it. Your mileage may vary
Such an awsome addition to the star wars universe

Had no sound initially. After hours of searching and reinstalled drivers and oculus apps. I found a post on the forums saying theres a known bug with Windows 10 1903 stopping sound from working in certain Oculus apps. Once I updated windows itself again. Sound came back!

Also no options for being left handed. So your lightsaber is always on your right hip. Meaning you have to go across your body to grab it everytime. 

Other than those two things. Im enjoying the 30mins I managed to play after taking hours to get it going.

This was the Star Wars experience I have been waiting for! Felt amazing, played amazing and nothing quite like firing up the lighsabre to brighten your day.

It is a bit on the short side but the Lightsabre Dojo will provide lots of replayability for those that want it and for $15AU I can't really complain at all :-D.

Looking forward to Episode 2!

Combat is dissapointing. One blaster deflection fight and one saber fight which makes it the weakest part of the game. In the arena mode you are fighting bland  endless waves of droids with a lightsaber, which is only fun for so long. One big annoyance to the combat system is that if I swing my saber into a strike the saber will just go through the vibrosword and hit me. This really takes me out of it since I have to just keep blocking until it lets me hit it, no freedom of attacking.

Your droid companion isn't terrible but just talks too much and I just couldn't get that voice out of my head. I understand that they need someone to answer the questions for you since your player doesn't say anything but it gets to a point where the pestering is just annoying. 

Darth Vader is the best part of the game and is the saving grace. I never felt how much I would be outmatched by him until now. This is the only reason why I would say that the story mode is worth playing.

Frankly, I'm not a huge Star Wars nerd. I  haven't seen all the new movies and I watched more Star Trek as a kid than anything... the first SW movie I ever saw was Episode 1.  BUT, I am a videogame nerd and I am always looking for cool cinematic experiences...  The lightsaber battles are really rudimentary but enjoyable and the narrative moves along at a good clip with lots of cool dialogue from your droid partner.  If you like SW you might get a little more out of it than I did, but I felt like I got my 10 bucks worth either way and I look forward to the next episode.

review_title: Nice but short, some improvements needed
one_reviews_text:
The experience was overall, really GREAT, the lightsaber felt life I had a real one in my hand, but the combats against droids were slow and their movements were sometimes kinda hard to read but overall predictable (it's first episode I expect it's normal, and in the future, combat will be harder), the laser shot reflect is perfect.
The game was still buggy when I played it, I had to enter an elevator through its roof with the ladder, but at some point I got an out of bound error that made my screen black so i released my grip and got back on top of the elevator, the roof closed and I was stuck there for the whole descent (I had to quit and resume to fix it but still)
I played on the Rift S, and a lot of scenes were in the dark, and it's not really comfortable with lcd screen, because the black smear occulted the details in thoses scenes

Now here's what i suggest to improve in future episodes :
- Remove out of bound error, it's experience killing
- Light up some scenes for the rift S or let us set brightness
- ADD SUBTITLES PLEASE, at least the english ones, at this point, it's a crime

Going in, I knew this was about an hour long. But it is a great hour with high production values. My only complaint would be the droid that accompanies you, it is SO annoying! Disney SW droids are so talky and use casual slang phrases that no droid in the original 6 movies used. It stands out so much and made me hate the character. I was so disappointed that I couldnt cut it in half myself!
BUT! All in all, a strong first showing.
***Played on an original Rift***

I enjoyed it, however, I see some need for improvements. Great visuals, but I was hoping to use the lightsaber on storm troopers, not just reflecting their laser blasts.  The game hints at some stealth, but it's too directed. I wanted to explore, not be led. Sneak up on my enemies, not just hack and slash. Maybe some easter eggs to find, not just movie quotes. The idea of immersive environments is to let you decide what your doing, not just a walking tour with some climbing elements. Let us explore on our own. This is what VR is lacking...a great story, as well as an open world feel. Wow me, but set me free.

This is one of the more polished VR games, in league with Lone Echo. It's very short and sweet. If this is meant to be a taste of the future in VR then it makes me very excited.

One thing that kept bugging me throughout this episode is how much the game loves to glue your feet to the ground. You cannot move in combat, and almost everything you interact with requires you to be locked in place directly infront of it. It always frustrates me when games take freedom away from the player, even more so in VR.

Otherwise it was very good. Hand animations are very smooth and precise, there is minimal 'snapping' when you grab onto things. I was particularly impressed with the hands gripping the crossbow (just a shame you can't use it!)

Looking forward to more :)

This game is really short, feels like its just getting started then its over, thankfully the dojo offers additional gameplay which makes it worth the buy. Not fond of the locomotion in this game, don't like to use teleportaion, feels like being tethered. If you a star wars fan, get this game.

review_title: The Dojo alone is worth it!
one_reviews_text:
Loved it on the Quest. With the Rift S you can enjoy much better visuals!
Cant wait for the next two installments. But for any Star Wars fan this is a must!

review_title: it let me use a lightsaber to cut stuff
one_reviews_text: ok so this game instantly gets a 5 star rating simple because they gave me a lightsaber and told me to cut stuff. there are a few minor complaints like how much climbing there is, or the fact that the game is reletivly short but the fact that within the first 10 minutes you have a lightsaber and then are expected to be all jedi like is amazing. i would personaly pay the $10 price simply to fight waves of enemies but the fact that the story is good makes the $10 price seem like a steal. all and all this was a good purchase on my part and im awaiting the sequel.

Like all the reviews are saying its short, and ends on a cliff hanger. I hope there will be an episode 2, but who knows if they feel its worth the investment. It was gorgeous visually, voice acting was well done, bunch of interactible dodads to mess with, and the bonus mode (light saber training) is genuinely fun.

This is what I have been waiting for since VR was a thing. Although it's been mildly introduce previously in Oculus with the Star Wars Trials On Tatooine...that was more of a demo than anything else. This the real deal. The scale is epic, the immersion is fantastic and having Darth Vader stand menacingly before you is unforgettable. Although short, there is replay value through the arena...and it's worth the price of entry. I look forward to continuing the story. Just awesome.

As soon as i saw this on the oculus store i had to buy it and turns out i was not disappointed when playing this game, the training mode is the first thing i played as i wanted to hold a lightsaber ASAP. Im going to try the campaign as soon as i get home from work. If someone please can mod this game to be able to further the features in thisproduct then by all means i would buy a second copy

review_title: Bad computers can run this game.
one_reviews_text: This game is amazing, i really wanted it and i was worried my computer could not run it. But it runs amazing, it does not even lag, truly a great game, only draw back it the 30min- to 45  min playing time.  Ihave palayed threw it 4 times and i have not gotten bored at all.  Probally my favrite vr game

review_title: Qiuck but well worth the 10 bucks!
one_reviews_text:
If you area Star Wars fan this is a must. Yes you are basically paying for a long demo but the best Star war experience you get get in VR. Graphics are fantastic and game play is excellent.  No spoiler alerts here but like I said. Star Wars fan... 10 bucks easy decision and no regrets. 
  Okay quick update the replay value in the Dojo is AMAZING!

If someone said to me "hey give me £7 and you can be in a starwars short film for an hour" it would be stupid for me to say no... keep this in mind if you are a starwars fan. Personally i loved this experience, i thought it would be mostly watching and little interaction but i was wrong, lots of quirky little ways you help the story along. Graphics are amazing and i can confirm this runs on high detail on my i5-7600k with 1060 and 16gb ram regardless of the higher listed recommended specs. Yes ok it's quite a short experience but for £7 am i really going to complain? nope, instead i am EAGERLY awaiting Episode 2.

The only reason this is getting such great reviews is because it is a Star Wars game. The game play is short and anytime you move the screen goes black longer than normal for a teleporting game. Also, what is with the limited move of motion, it is like my game room is cut in half. If this was any other game it wouldnt get half of the good ratings.

review_title: UNREAL! I was blown away by this!
one_reviews_text: This is a quantum leap compared to other similar VR experiences out there, and worth every penny of the $10 price tag. I felt like I was in a Star Wars movie! Being able to use a light saber the way it was meant to be was also a plus. This is a MUST HAVE for anyone looking for a real VR game. You will not be disappointed by this. Highly recommended! I can't wait for Episode 2 to come out now. Thank you so much to the developers of Vader Immortal for making this. The VR market seriously needs more titles like this one. Just buy it folks. Your eyeballs with thank you.

This game has been something that almost every person who have seen Star Wars wanted. The story telling is incredible, graphics on the RIft and Rift S are great. Almost everything about the game is good. One thing that everyone is probably thinking after they completed it is, "Already?" The game is short (not including the Dojo). When all three episodes are released, I hope the developers can make it so that players can access all episodes whithout buying all the episodes, like a bundle. I rate this game five stars, the reason why is that even though the game is short, it has great features, and episode two and three will probably do the same.

review_title: Far far away from a premium S.W. game
one_reviews_text:
Let me start with the obvious, this is not worth 9,99.
It's an hour long, at max., full of bugs related to movement and camera placement.

It's not bad, it has good ambientation; good voice over; good lightsabers; sound and climbing. But in the final fight I had to fight against the "return to the game" screen more than I had to fight enemies and seeing that after the game telling me that my space is small is just dumb. If its small then how am I always "outside" of the game?  

They need to up their game if they want me to keep buying their Star Wars games, I know I'm not gonna buy episode 2(wich should have been part of the same game with 1 price point.. and not 3)

As a Star Wars nerd, I absolutely loved this game. Though it was short, I can cut it some slack as it's part of a three-part series. The story is amazing (so far) and I have no bad things to say about this game. If you want a fun experience, and you're a Star Wars fan, you should definitely get this game. It's worth every penny.

A good intro to a game, but not much more. Quite buggy as I got stuck many times in objects and scenes - having to restart the game.
I wouldn't buy a sequel if it has the same amount of content as this one, but a full release could be worth much more.

review_title: witness the force (of passion n talent)
one_reviews_text: Wow ! This is a child's dream came true since i was blown away by the original trilogy in movie theater ! VR's magic at its best.

I was expecting more action, but it is pretty much 3 battles which are quite short. I was expecting to be jumping around every other corner and slicing robot arms off etc :(
I do like a good story though and I felt that part was done extremely well. I did feel very led through it and it would have been nice to have a few genuine puzzles that took some working out. This could have increased game time if you had to enter different areas then go back on yourself after finding key items etc, but no it is completely linear. If you want to be part of a movie like sequence with no particularly hard challenge then this is for you. The fact you are in a star wars world is amazing and the light saber is excellent. I have to give this 4 stars for quality, but for me it was more of a kids game based on the challenges, but that's just me. Hoping the next one is a bit harder. Can you actually die I ask myself? I guess I need to go back and stand there like a lemon and see if I do. :)

I want so badly to rate this 5-Stars because it is an absolutely amazing experience on the Rift S, but I do have a few small complaints.
-Extremely dark causing directional disorientation
-Able to randomly walk through walls which results in an annoying “return to game world” message and takes a bit to get reoriented
-Setting to change the camera rotation from snap to smooth motion with the joystick doesn’t appear to work
-TOO SHORT

That all being said, this game is an absolute blast and I can see myself playing through many times while I wait for episode 2. Lightsaber controls are fluid and responsive, climbing ladders is neat, graphics are stellar, storytelling and immersion is top-notch. Reminded me of the VOID VR experience at Disney Springs. Hoping we get to use the Force and/or blasters in the next game.
Ii was an amazing experience but it was too short. the price is extremly high copareing it to its lenght. Dont buy it, not worth it.

If your a fan of star wars then you will love this game. It may be short at the moment but this is only part one of a three part series. The lightsaber combat is amazing and makes you feel like a jedi or sith. Overall I would definatly recommend this game.

AAA Experience for sure, can't wait for the next chapters, I hope they are working on them right now!!!
I just wish they had implemented an option to steer where your controller is pointing instead of head direction; head direction is horrible!!  It forces you to side step with the locomotion when looking around PLEASE LEARN DEVS and give us options!
The smooth turning option doesn't appear to work at all either; it snap turns on whatever setting is chosen.

Wow.  For $10 USD, I was immersed in so much Star Wars lore I can barely contain myself.  As a HUGE fan, I hope to see more full length VR Star Wars titles.  This was one of the most fun and polished experiences I've seen to date.  Star Wars is a BIG property and one that belongs on the Rift.

It wasn't a game so much as it was an interactive cinematic experience but it works so well.  While I hope to see the day of playing something reminiscent of Jedi Academy on the Rift, I'll hold on to my pants while I await the future episodes of Vader Immortal.

this is what ive been wanting for so long like the saber and how it sounds and looks this feels like real life or something but i cant wait for ep 2 and learn the force you know what im exsited for all of them if there all $10 then this will brobly   be the best selling game on the market. keep up the graet work, love joeybaggs

review_title: OMG, finally!  I am Star Wars Immersed
one_reviews_text:
Seriously freaking awseome.  I found myself blown away!!  Ok, you'll read all these cool reviews becuase it is just that, SO COOL!  My dreams as a kid watching the first Staw Wars movie have come true, today.

Buy the game, it is not as long as I want it to be, but hey.. it is so worth it.  My kid loved it, I love it, my wife IS GOING to love it and I am going to get everyone on my block to try this thing out.

Bring more SOON, going through withdrawls..

review_title: Loved every precious minute of it!
one_reviews_text: And the minutes ARE precious in this game as it is very very short!  If it were not for the excellent story and voice acting I'd have knocked off a star, but the game is just so wonderfully produced that what there is more than makes up for the length.  I'll not spoil a thing here.  I'll only say that even though it's short it is worth a buy at the current price in my opinion.  Coming out in Episodes is OK with me.  It gives me the opportunity to have something to look forward to.

review_title: This is why I got into VR!
one_reviews_text:
My first experice with VR was at "The VOID", where I played Secrets of the Empire. As a huge Star Wars fan it was a dream come true to feel like I was actually in the universe. They used Oculus headsets and so I followed suit getting a Rift at the end of 2018.

I've played many awesome games since thine (ie: Lone Echo) and have not regretted my purchase but I felt like I was missing something from my original experience. Vader Immortal has brought back that initial excitement.

The game has the right amount of interactivity and narrative story telling to really make you feel like you are in a movie. I can't wait for episode II to arrive.

First, I am not a big fan of all movies. But i have to say, this game..... WOW!           It really blow me away. Cant wait to play the other ones that comes. I tried to do a video of my first gamplay, but unfortunately the sound went missing in the video. No point in doing it twice. Maybe i will do one for part 2.

Prodigious !


Hope dev read comment:
If possible, appreciate:

French subtil in the next episode update.
Delete the black box limite indicator.

I will probably showing an extream patience by waiting the 2 next episode before play again the full lenght game.


Oh yes, it s very short, but for what the experience offer you and the price, we will not spit on it ! however, develloper getting the prodigious idea to do training features room, with some multiple situation to get, different crystal light saber color to unlock, different light saber skin.

Getting to stage 5 on 20 from my memory, more than 20 stage wait you, very challenging, need technique, and look random position ball, random attack for each time you start, very nice praticing to counter attack with droid who simulate light saber duuel.
And to finish, extra to unlock, as purple light saber, orange, green etc... different handle, 3 different area ambiance

So, you need call the force, may be with you.
Because the end of this episode, is exactly what player was don t dream about, and this is exactly what player need from our day with all that recycled game, exept some one...



Thx develloper to make this prodigious quality jewel at lower price player can t expect !

And i clearly hope next stazr wars game from this develloper after the release of episode 3

review_title: What are people on about? Its worth $10!
one_reviews_text: The story is short, yes. It is fantastic, but it is really short. But no one talks about the dojo! Its a 40 level progressive wave mode that you fight off enemies and deflect fire with your lightsaber. It is basic, but its so fun! It totally gives the game replay value and makes it worth $10 dollars!

review_title: Like playing one of the films
one_reviews_text: Vader Imortal was amazing. The fact that this episode one makes me exsited to see where the story will lead. The sound was awesome and the atomsphere was tence. i had such a big smile across my face the whole time!

***SLIGHT SPOILER***


In quality, 10/10. However, it's probably best to wait for the entire thing to be out before dishing out any $ for it. I beat it in about 30-40 minutes. There's not enough combat going on, only 2 sequences; just deflecting some blasters and then fighting the same enemy over and over for a few minutes with the same attack pattern. If they're going to charge $10 or so for games here, average duration should be in description. 
Now if you're a massive Star Wars fan, this will scratch a surface itch, nothing more. I'm concerned how many episodes there will be and how much it will cost once completed, how much overall content there will be.

review_title: the force is with you on this
one_reviews_text: i don't normally do reviews but i have to say that this is great ok it is short 40 minutes and there is some parts you can interact with in the story but there is not much but it looks so good and the dojo is amazing where you can fight robots with a light sabre is just amazing don't know how many levels there are as i am only up to 21 but it's one of those games i like to go back to. it could do with being cheaper but if this is chapter 1 i am looking forward to chapter 2 when it gets released i hope. just to be in the star wars universe is amazing.

In terms of atmosphere, currently the best game on Rift. However, this is to large extent due to the world of Start wars, quite simply. Fighting alongside Vader... not much can get near this.

Having said that, if we remove "star wars" then a relatively "simple" and way too short interactive novel remains. Of course, the visuals are stunning. But the riddles are way too simple. Seriously, please make the "repair" minigames a bit more engaging. All of them could be completed within a few seconds. 

I am optimistic this will happen, and this was just a first step.

i always reason with myself that spending money for experiences is way better than a movie. This game is visually pleasing and perfect for the fan that wantts to play a role in an intense story. As long as you immerse yourself and arent the childish vr player just aimlessly trying to grab everything without paying attention. at only 10 bucks youll be pleased.

It only took them 3 years to capitalize on two cash-making markets: Star Wars fans, and VR immersion. Why it took 3 years to make a short, 30 minute game combining these two elements of profit? That is beyond me; but after all the wondering and waiting: you finally get to swing a lightsaber. The graphics are amazing, but the length of play is not. Yes, replayability can be found in the dojo, but it would've been cool to have a 2hr story game. It did leave you with blue balls after such a long wait for a Star Wars game with such beautiful VR graphics, to only be 30 minutes long. Maybe someday, they'll figure out a way to make money off us by making an X-wing fighter game as well?

so yes this is a short experience, which is a real bummer considering that there are full vr games with similiar interactivity and combat. the setting however is uniqely starwars and with that i feel they get a pass on shortness. then agian i imagine a full game should be made out of this. preferably a open world game where you use a ship to navagate planet to planet like no mans sky, but im sure thats out of reach for now. that said what we do get is a fun star wars tie in with good quality. i did have some graphical issues and some bugs that required me to restart, but man this one really shows potential. i couldnt beleive you couldnt throw your saber, i mean it feels great in raw data and while im sure theyre goin to add it, i feel another episode would kind of suck. weve seen the gallery starseed and how episodes tend to vary greatly, compared to a all in one game. i would love it if this was the prequil and the full game comes next. a huge game built off these climbing and combat mechanics. the arena does give you something to pour more time into, but man the ending fight was awsome, im no star wars fanboy but dang vader is a bad dude. awsome fight scene, while at the same time your fighting too. super neat. lightsaber can be blinding at times though making it hard to fight or deflect stuff.

I've owned this game since it came out on the 20th, and I have yet to actually play the game.  When I try to launch the program it continuously for crashes, and refuses to load any part of the game. I've tried uninstalling, and reisntalling it 4 times now, with 0 success.  I'm sure this is an amazing game if you can get it to launch. So far I'd rather leave a 0 star rating, becuase it has been a waste of $12.

A little short(I know it's only a chapter) but the dojo makes up for it. The graphics are great and you get to use a lightsaber and see Lord Vader up close and personal.   Worth the price for sure. This is the game I'm going to use to show off my VR to guests.  Only reason I gave 4 stars was I had a couple of glitches that made playing annoying.  A reload of the game fixed them in the end.  All hail the Dark Side.

This game really is a work of art, and the story telling is awesome. Its great to see Vader your self, very surreal almost to see this scary dude. I love the graphics and the lore. Though for some strange reasone. My right controller will not grab ANYTHING.. and it's pissed me off alot. Almost ruined my experience. This would of gotten a 5 stars if the grab on my right controller actually worked at all.

review_title: Great experience for Star Wars fans
one_reviews_text:
A great experience for Star Wars fans, not really a game as such, more of an interactive adventure. The visuals are great, sound is great. The classic Star Wars Atmosphere is there. 

The only problem is the length, I really wish this could be longer. I realise this is only episode 1 of 3, but if every episode is the same length then it will only add up to 2-3 hours experience.  I hope this concept eventually evolves into something grander.

review_title: Amazing until it ends way too soon!
one_reviews_text: I get that this is "Episode: 1" but holy moly is this short. It ends right when it's about to get good. Hopefully they won't be charging $10 per episode if they're all gonna be this short. But other than that, everything else is great. Graphics, atmosphere and thankfully there's a dojo room that adds a LITTLE (emphasis on little) replay ability. I would've been satisfied enough if it was $5 but $10 felt like way too much for what seriously felt like a demo .

review_title: Fun but short for the money
one_reviews_text:
A fun experience, but at only 40 minutes this is not worth $10.  This is why I buy everything I can from steam.  Games are cheaper and if something offers less than 2 hours content you can refund it.  

The lightsaber stuff works well and feels pretty good, I don't understand why you are rooted to the spot and can't move during fights though.

It looks great and the story kept my attention, but there is just not enough for the money.

review_title: So Enjoyable I Was Mad When It Ended
one_reviews_text: The story line, lightsaber combat experience, and (spoiler) meeting Darth Vader and potentially being his apprentice was the best Star Wars experience I've played on any platform. Easily the best part was the lightsaber combat which has zero lag and challenging practice opponents. Above and beyond is the story line which fits well into the overall Star Wars universe...When/where is part two and multiplayer!

This is the game I've been waiting for.   After ponying up $40 to play secrets of th empire at the VOID in an AMC, i feel ripped off.   This is what that should have been.   This game gives you a much longer experience for 1/4 the cost.  The fact that i can replay it for free is a bonus.  These graphics are better and the play is smoother.  What an experience.  I feel like i was in the worlds and exhausted and excited at the same time.   Any fan of starwars should own this.  This is the best game i played on any VR system.  This is what Oculus was made for.   After owning the Rift for over a year, this is the game that made me feel it was worth the purchase.

Vader, stormtroopers, robots all looks so real ! I'm really thrilled when Vader is standing in front of me.  The lightsaber feels so good that you want to keep practicing using it !! Definitely worth the $$.   Really look forward to play the upcoming episodes.

I have to say, for 10 dollars, this is definitely worth it.  The visual detail in this game is phenomenal.  Vader looks realistic and I have to say terrifying.  I'm not a short guy but I was still looking up to him a little.  He's really tall.  The small 40-45 minutes story is awesome.  I definitely can't wait for part 2.  I hope we don't have to wait long.  I really want more.  Don't pass this up.  If motion sickness isn't an issue, then use full locomotion.  It just adds alot to the immersion.  If you do get motion sickness then there's a teleport feature for you.

This first episode plays out like a space opera, where your loyalites will be challenged and questioned, right along with your light saber skills. As you progress deeper into the story, you can't help but feel like you're another major character in the epic story of light vs. dark, with a climactic ending that leaves you wanting more.

About the more part - the experience lasts about 45 minutes. It's short, but for $10.00 it beats sitting in a theater when instead you're part of the action. From facing off with Stormtroopers, to working your way secretly around, you'll have a blast skiffing and climbing around. The graphics are top-notch and the game ran smoothly on my GTX 1070, i7-6700, 16GB system.

The light saber training dojo is pretty cool, but the battles feel real. It's just not real swordplay - more like Star Wars swordplay, but trust me, you won't care one bit. It's all part of the story, and the story plays out very well. Think Lone Echo storytelling quality. Every thing keeps the story moving forward - there's no time to get bored. I'm looking forward to the next chapter.

One of the most polished games I played so far in VR graphically. Also really great to experience some actual SW feeling in VR. Too short for sure but ok 2 more episodes to come. Boundaries/guidance in the game is too strict though - could be better implemented. If you lean forward too much or walk just a little to the side it will hide the game and give you an out of bounds warning. You also need to stand exactly in certain spots for the story to continue. Great basis though - hope to get more of this in the future.

I dont understand the reviews for this, must be their first vr experience. The game is totally linear, way shorter than I thought it would be. It runs bad on my 2060 laptop, On low graphics settings and I dont know why, It isnt that pretty. Looks quite bad on Rift S because a lot of it is dark and the blacks are grey on LCD. How do you not get to shoot a blaster is beyond me. Very underwelmed

Superb environment - It feels like being inside the first third to a half of a Star Wars film (40 mins out of 1.5-2 hours).   

Only demerit is the over zealous re-centering system.   Just let me move FFS, even if its to an area that doesnt make sense and stop killing immersion by popping up this annoying "Go back to center" screen if I move less than a foot from the centre of a my play space.

Will definitely buy the next installment.  Hopefully they remove the re-centering bot by then.

as a life long Star Wars fan ive been waiting for the first proper SWVR title, this as far as it goes is fantastic. Its not a game, not an app, not long but it draws you in to the universe and has enough interaction to keep it interesting. Great storyline and excellent production values all help and when the Destroyer flies above you is an amzing feeling. A monthly episodic experience like this i would happily subscribe to.

review_title: It is short, but its amazing to a SW fan
one_reviews_text: Being a huge SW nerd I probably a bit bias on this game. The visuals are amazing, the combat isnt difficult but its not simple enough to be boring. Seeing Vader approach me was intense after always finding him scary when I was a kid lol. $10 isnt bad a price to pay for what looks to be a great series. I just hope each one can be a bit longer than the last. Look forward to it regardless!

While I do not care for any of the new disney led star wars junk, this is worth it for the full licensed lightsabre experience.  Not sure why your companion droid has the voice of a buzzy midwest usa accountant with no filtering (I'd switch it out for GLADOS if possible) she seems a little out of place. But overall it is a ton of fun for 10 bucks.

Darth Vader, Light Saber combat, nice graphics...But it's a rip off, extremely short experience..3 episodes, probably 1.5-2 hour combined will cost 30 bucks at the end.  A single episode should be at least 1 - 1.5 hour in my opinion, but they are still ripping us off with appealing titles with short play times because there is lack of content !!

The game is amazing fun just being in the middle of Star Wars is sick. I went crazy the first time I wielded a lightsaber!  This game would deserve 5 stars if it was longer and I didn't experience several oculus breaking bugs. 

Unfortunately the game is only about an hour long and I don't understand why the developer couldn't have made it any longer. All the game resources that are implemented make sense so it's just up to the developer to actually make a longer story. There might be a part two but I wish this was a full game not just an experience!
Also the game made my oculus crash several times after 2 minutes or gameplay, so none of the sensors on the oculus or controllers would get detected until the pc is restarted.

review_title: Pretty immersive and well thought out
one_reviews_text:
I think that it isn't exactly the 10 bucks worth, for such a short game (about 30-40 mins length).

However, it's a great Star Wars experience, the machnics of crawling, unlocking doors and especially.. lightsaber fighting and deflecting of laser bullets is just very very satisfying. I really wish you would be able to do more though, as.. go up to Stormtroopers and cut them in half, arms off, legs off etc. stuff like that, just for the fun of it. or even grab them, hit them with your hands etc.

I hope that the next episode, which will focus on force powers will be more in depth with everything.

Also, the game NEEDS 2 things especially!..

1. Allow people to choose their lightsaber color
2. Brightness adjustment, the game is SOOOO dark at times, and e.g. when recording, it becomes even darker.

Other than that, I definitely recommend this.

review_title: Great, with a few minor issues.
one_reviews_text:
Agree with much of the feedback given already. It's quite short, but that's reflected in the price and it's a great look at what's to come in future episodes. Vader has a great presence.

Everything was a bit too dark and washed out on the Rift S, some sort of setting to adjust that under Video options would be appreciated.

Also don't know where else to bring this up, but I ran into a relatively small bug. 
(Minor Spoiler Ahead, I'll keep it vague.)
In the part where you're climbing outside of the facility, and you need to take your partner's hand to help you up, they wouldn't let go of my hand after pulling me up. I was dragged along and then couldn't move to progress further. Fixed by restarting the game and replaying the section, however.

review_title: Would be 5 stars if it was longer
one_reviews_text: Had a really fun time, felt intimidated by Vader, felt awesome when I picked up the lightsaber and was really immersed by the game mechanics. Only qualms are the length and the weird fade out and large blue arrows that appear when you're looking the wrong way. Must buy!

I didnt watch a walkthrough or any reviews of Vader Immortal, so i wasnt sure what to expect. Maybe some light storytelling and basic gameplay. 

Well, I was half wrong and half right. 

The storytelling is actually my favorite part. They did a fantastic job sucking you into the character and everything around you. It was a very satisfying experience.

The gameplay was definitely basic. Even down to the lightsaber dueling. But that doesnt mean it wasnt fun. Interacting with things and walking around was a joy minus using ladders, that could have been done differently. 

And of course what everybody wants to hear about, the lightsaber action. When I first got the saber and picked it up, turning it on, my heart raced for one of the numerous times througout the experience. Its what you would expect, blocking and swinging. It feels a little mechanical mostly. But enjoyable nonetheless. 

Graphics were superb. Environment is immersive. And gameplay is nothing special. But definitely worth 10 bucks if youre a big Star Wars fan.

The female droid single handedly ruins this game. It takes an otherwise cool story, cool environment etc.. and makes a complete joke out of the game. But then again that's just like the entire franchise. One big kids movie parody of it's former self. That droid was just too much. Incredibly annoying.  Aside from that and the fact that it is criminally short it was a pretty cool demo. Nothing ground breaking but the visuals look solid. Little pricey for a demo but whatever. It's worth a play.

I appreciate the willingness to take risks in a particular climbing section.  I imagine some people to fall flat on their bum during it, but they left it in, and it was a good decision.   Overall the expierence was pretty great.  If it was a little longer, this would be the best VR expierence on the Oculus store.  I don't like how the game locks you into position during fight sequences hopefully they add to the combat mechanics where the AI can both attack and track your position - something dynamic like RoboRecall.

Don't buy this thinking you're buying a game, you'd be really disappointed. It's really just a short experience (feels like what the very short intro of a game should be). Also, you've always got to follow the steps of your annoying droid 'friend' so you cant' show any initiative (if you try to go somewhere you need to go before him/her/it, you're just sopped and have to wait!

Disclaimer: I admit I'm a SW fanboy. That established I'm not sure it would matter. I want more. The experience itself is one of the best I've had so far and keeps my faith in the development for us early adopters who haven't had a whole lot to write home about. Granted, it's mostly story and little action, but when the action does come into play it throws you into the role more than the "passenger" walking/riding. The scenery takes you straight into the SW galaxy and the sound is spot on as well.  If you never thought TIE fighters, stormtroopers, or Vader were intimidating acbozi  ****no spoilers from me****

Mechanics are about the same as say Lone Echo with a mix of Raw Data, and although it was short but sweet , all I can say is whether it's a full game or continued episodic release, I will definitely sink my money into this. It's $10, so what do you really have to lose?

Not like some of the other stupid short apps that expect you to pay twice, this game if you own on Quest then you own on Rift.  Graphics are amazing, and the experience is alot of fun.  While its more of a experience than a game, it does have a mini game built in with light sabers for replay value.  If you do not own it, it is more than worth the $10 asking price, getting to feel like your actually in Start Wars.

Biggest complaint would be in dogo mode, physics seem to be off.  I'm on level 29 and there seems to be times when I block and their saber seems to go right through my saber and kill me with no reasoning as to how this is occuring I can only assume its a bug or physics problem.  I get it supposed to be hard, but their saber going through my saber and killing me when I'm clearly blocking their hit isn't logical.  Also when you hit Oculus menu and do a recenter view, if the game thinks your outside of the playarea it maintains thinking that, instead of resetting view in app and putting the circle where you reset the view to.

I do understand that this game was originally made from a knock off version of VR and finally made its way to Oculus. This is the type of graphics and VR solo game I would expect and am so happy to experiance! Great short film too! I want an entire movie like that and also the ability to have loco motion. Make a multi-play combat virsion now!

I was worried that I would not get to experience this game but am definitely glad I was able to play this on the OG Rift. Although it was short, I had a great time and believe it was worth the 10 bucks. It ran really smooth on my PC and the lightsaber gameplay was pretty awesome. This is truly an experience you should play.

review_title: The Most Immersive Star Wars Experience
one_reviews_text:
Let’s face it, ten dollars in VR is like spending .99 cents in the app store.
This is a short (54 minutes for me) VR experience but it is WELL worth your money. You will not feel closer to the Star Wars Universe unless you go to a theme park or movie studio (this feels like you are visiting Mustafar)
Facing Vader and traversing Mustafar could not be a more enthralling experience. With climbing and saber battles, you’d be hard pressed to find someone who did not have a little bit of fear when looking Darth Vader in the face after all these years.
The second part MUST have more puzzle solving and intensive lightsaber battles though.
Although quite linear, the experience is one you do not want to miss, and has been one of my favorite VR moments in the life of my Rift. Although some might disagree, there IS joy in repetition when replaying titles like this, and it seems that there are many levels in Vader’s Dojo to keep you entertained until the next part releases.
This is well worth your $10, because be honest, you have spent more than $10 dollars on less rewarding experiences since you purchased your VR headset.
Games like Vader Immortal will start changing the VR landscape for the better, and supporting such a rounded Quest (although I played on Rift) title is only going to make VR become more mainstream.

Early game mild spoilers: Engaging Hyperspace and then landing on Mustafar has been the most intense “space” simulations I have experienced with the Rift, and I play a lot of Elite Dangerous.

Apart from the occasional fade-to-black whenever you stick your head too close to a wall, prompting you to lean/go back to your playspace, this is super awesome.
For the first time ever it actually felt as if I was right in the moment as a lightsaber wielding person.
Even the combat at the end required me to put some real effort into my stance and saber wielding moves instead of just willy-nilly holding the controler left and right to auto-block.
The now somewhat "old" CV1 Rift and its low resolution was also not very noticeable in most instances, because there is just so much to look at you don't really pay attention to it, unless you'd be in it just to nitpick. :D
Also...

Vader Immortal is a full fledged Star Wars experience which shows what a first person Star Wars game could be capable of on Virtual Reality, you have few puzzles, lightsabering, deflecting blaster shots and even a interesting plot exploring the history of planet Mustafar.

However, this experience is SHORT. It took me less than 40 minutes to actually go through and when I got to the end it felt like "Is this it? Did it end already?" and not in a good way but in a bad way.

The game suffers from few bugs here and there where your screen will be blank but fixing this usually needs you to just move your head.

The graphic options are just high and low, nothing to tinker in between, but the experience uses Unreal Engine, so ini modifying should prove higher image quality in the future.

The audio was positional and it felt delightful to turn my head and listen to the characters. 

I would recommend this experience only to the most hardcore Star Wars fans for the asking price. It essentially feels like a paid demo and at 9.99 it's not simply worth the asking price for what you get in the story. You also get some Oculus Home items and a Lightsaber dojo to practice your lightsaber skills, but I would personally recommend getting Fruit Ninja or Beat Saber, both games that will offer you either more content or a better price.

review_title: A little short for a Stormtr... Game
one_reviews_text:
Lets get the Cons out of the way. 
The game takes 45 minutes to finish
It's pretty much on rails
Blasters fire at you VERY slowly

Now for the Pros:
Excellent voice acting
Very immersive
Just enough exposition that you understand but not enough that you feel they are cramming story in
Beautiful visuals, especially during the one major "storytelling" portion
Some of the best lightsaber mechanics I've played

This is a fantastic "game". As I've said, it's very short, and the main story has little replay value. But the "minigame" portion that keeps upping the difficulty is really nice. The blaster shots in the minigame come at you a little faster, and it makes it feel closer to the "real" thing. 

If you aren't big into Star Wars, this isn't gonna do it for you. This game banks on the fact that the people playing are looking for any piece of canon that could be mined for more details. I won't talk about spoilers here, but there is plenty teased in this game. 

The $10 pricetag hurts a bit, but I'm sure I'll get my moneys worth in the minigame. I am excited for the next two portions, and I hope they offer a bit more content. This is a really great hamburger, when I really want steak.

review_title: Awesome VR Wish it was longer
one_reviews_text:
Played on Rift S - with Bionik Mantis Ear Phones
Let's start with the bad. ( Ok its short 45 minutes or so ).  You don't have the freedom of movement one would love to have with in a title such as this. You are set on a pre-determined path you have to follow.  There wasn't enough action in my eyes personally during the experience. Few buttons, switches etc. But lacking in what i'd say would make it a 5 start totally mind blowing experience. 
Character interaction would have been a bit better with more ways to confront the storm troopers, vader, etc. 
That Said.
The Good. It's a truly awesome virtual reality experience (not mind blowing but awesome.. The details of the warp, the space ship, etc you literally felt like you were in an actual Star Wars Movie. Graphics were incredible ( even tho in many areas they were quite dark and lacked enough detail ). The darkness however did give it this ominous feeling throughout the game experience.  
Lord Vader was as real as he could get towering in his awesome cloak and helmet. 
I give this a 4 star rating mostly because the cinematic styling of the game places you as near ( IN a movie) as one could possibly get. There is room for improvement from the Devs regarding Character interactions, being allowed to make different choices to figure things out, taking different routes etc. However all in all I loved and enjoyed the experience this game provided.  
I ran this on high settings on the Rift S with the Graphics tweaked in oculus diagnostic tools to 2.0. and increased ingame graphics to 1.5 as well. 
Running I7-8700 3.20GHz, 16G ram, GTX 1080.
Was it worth the price of admission? for me Absolutely. It takes a ton of work hours, man power, designers, etc to create anything in virtual reality and often times some titles just fail. This however does not fail. If you are a star wars fan and want to be plopped into what id say was an awesome teaser with hopes that many more chapters follow this would be one to Jump into.

review_title: Best VR Title I've Played But Too Short!
one_reviews_text:
As a huge Star Wars fan, I was really excited for this.  The only reason I'm giving it four stars is the length.  I beat it in less than an hour, and I feel like I took my time.  The visuals, the story, the combat, all amazing and more polished than most games out on Oculus now.  Some backdrops might not be the best quality, but other than that, everything was beautiful.

I feel like they really nailed the basic mechanics, so hopefully in later episodes, they go all out with the content.  I just imagine a VR title with these mechanics, but full length like KOTOR or even Jedi Outcast, and it makes me so excited to see what's in store for VR's future.  The combat is a lot of fun, I haven't been immersed enough to punch my ceiling fan in a long time.

I ran this on the regular Oculus Rift on a rig with a 1080ti, AMD FX 8350, and 16GB RAM and it ran perfectly.

Vader Immortal succeeds in looking and feeling authentically star wars. The visuals are great, although the lighting feels a bit lack luster, but the sound design is amazing. Voice acting is also good across the five characters we meet here. 

The world lacks authentic interactivity. You can't pick up the sabaac cards on your ship and toss them around, only preset items are interactable. What you can interactive with though feels incredibly seemless. The climbing especially was done well, with a semi-guided system that I feel makes it better than the climbing systems in other games like Lone Echo.

As for the combat, the lightsabre looks a bit stilted, 90fps still isn't enough to provide convincing motion to it, and the hit detection requires you to use slower swings which means at least flailing won't autowin, except you can't die here. There's a chapter system, but I could find no way to die. Ledges have invisible walls, falls do damage to you, the robots that strike you deal damage, but it's more of an annoyance and an eye ache than an actual mechanic. I would highly recommend turning damage indicators off, since you can't actually die in the main story.

As for price/content ratio, for £8 I got about an hour from the episode itself, and the dojo probably provides another hour or two. The dojo is probably the more gamelike section of this, with actual fail states, scoring and rewards that can be used in the main game.

Overall, it's a fun little episodic story with an interesting mini-game, though I think £8 is currently a stretch. I would recommend waiting for a bundle with all episodes is available.

This experience is quite spectacular while it lasts, especially for a Star Wars fan. It really gives you a taste of VR's future potential, but unfortunately takes it away from you while you're just getting into it.

The Story mode is about 45 minutes long, and takes you through a variety of authentic locations that genuinly feel as though they were ripped straight from the Star Wars Universe. Seeing Vader up close and fighting alongside him is definitely a highlight and I'm sure something many fans have dreamt of experiencing since they were children. Unfortunately, even if you take into consideration the low price tag and that fact that VR is still a comparitively small market, it simply felt far too short. 

The dojo mode will bring me back for another 3-5 hours I'd guess and I'll certainly be showing this to any friend that visits in the foreseeable future, but still...I can't quite shake the sour taste left in my mouth of what could have been if they'd stretched it out a bit longer.

Having said all that, I still definitely recommend it for the pricetag and it leaves me excited for the future of VR. Bring on Episode 2!

overall well worth $10, the story is very compelling, investigating (MINOR SPOILERS) Vader's fall to the dark side in more detail is enlightening (END SPOILERS), lightsaber fighting is fun, but it feels so easy, that being said this is episode 1 with training bots, I hope enemies get faster and stop telegraphing their next move for a painfully obvious 2-3 seconds, the graphics are pretty well done, except for some far away areas on mustafar are blurry.  A sense of presense is also well done, until the game tells you for the 20th time that you've ventured outside the play space and your screen goes black, and then it doesnt let you move around during a ton of the gameplay.  I feel like the door puzzles are oddly complex, like they are easy but it feels "forced" (pun intended) that a door would have a certain puzzle, climbing is meh.  I don't like how slow the locomotion is, and you only have snap turning or something very similar to it if youre using slide locomotion, not the end of the world.  Blaster bolts should be faster, maybe like lightblade VR fast, this speed just seems like they are babying you.
